import { Playground } from 'docz';

import ReactGlobe from './ReactGlobe';

# Globe

## Simple

Render a simple globe with one line of code and no props! Feel free to rotate and zoom on the globe!

<Playground>
  <ReactGlobe />
</Playground>

## Size

By default, `react-globe` is responsively sized to the parent container's size. You can pass an explicit `size` prop to disable responsive sizing.

<Playground>
  <ReactGlobe size={[300, 300]} />
</Playground>

## Background

By default, `react-globe` uses the specified `backgroundTexture` to render the background in the canvas. You can also disable texture backgrounds by setting the `enableBackground` value of `globeOptions` to `false`. This will allow you to use the parent container's background instead:

<Playground>
  <div
    style={{
      backgroundImage: 'linear-gradient(to right, red , yellow)',
    }}>
    <ReactGlobe
      globeOptions={{
        enableBackground: false,
      }}
    />
  </div>
</Playground>

## Clouds

You can disable and control various cloud properties in the `globeOptions` prop. Use the playground code editor to play around with the respective cloud options.

<Playground>
  <ReactGlobe
    globeOptions={{
      cloudsSpeed: 3,
      cloudsOpacity: 0.8,
      enableClouds: true,
    }}
  />
</Playground>

## Glow

You can disable and control various glow properties in the `globeOptions` prop. Use the playground code editor to play around with the respective glow options.

<Playground>
  <ReactGlobe
    globeOptions={{
      glowCoefficient: 0.1,
      glowColor: 'gold',
      glowPower: 4,
      glowRadiusScale: 0.5,
      enableGlow: true,
    }}
  />
</Playground>
